column3: ['Article 1 Legality of incrimination (1) Criminal law provides for the facts that constitute crimes. (2) No person may be punished for an act which was not provided for by the criminal law on the date when it was committed.']

['Article 2 Legality of penalties (1) Criminal law provides for the applicable penalties and educational measures that can be taken against the persons who have committed crimes, as well as the security measures that can be taken against the persons who have committed acts provided for by the criminal law. (2) No punishment or no educational measure or security measure can be taken if it was not provided by the criminal law on the date when the offence was committed. (3) No punishment can be established and applied beyond its general limits.']
['Article 3 Criminal law is applicable to crimes committed as long as it is in force.']

['Article 7 Application of temporary criminal law (1) The temporary criminal law applies to the offence committed during the time it was in force, even if the offence has not been pursued or judged within that period of time. (2) The temporary criminal law is the criminal law that provides for the date of its entry into force or whose application is limited by the temporary nature of the situation that imposed its adoption.']

['Article 8 Territory of the Criminal Law (1) Romanian Criminal Law applies to crimes committed on the territory of Romania. (2) The territory of Romania shall be understood as the extent of land, territorial sea and waters with soil, underground and airspace, covered between the state borders. (3) Crime committed on the territory of Romania shall be understood as any crime committed on the territory indicated in paragraph (2) or on a Romanian pavilion vessel or on an aircraft registered in Romania.']
